name: E1 ubiquitin-activating enzyme
reaction: ATP + ubiquitin + [E1 ubiquitin-activating enzyme]-L-cysteine = AMP + diphosphate + S-ubiquitinyl-[E1 ubiquitin-activating enzyme]-L-cysteine
comment: Catalyses the ATP-dependent activation of ubiquitin through the formation of a thioester bond between the C-terminal glycine of ubiquitin and the sulfhydryl side group of a cysteine residue in the E1 protein. The two-step reaction consists of the ATP-dependent formation of an E1-ubiquitin adenylate intermediate in which the C-terminal glycine of ubiquitin is bound to AMP via an acyl-phosphate linkage, then followed by the conversion to an E1-ubiquitin thioester bond via the cysteine residue on E1 in the second step.

references.title: Ubiquitin-activating enzyme. Mechanism and role in protein-ubiquitin conjugation.
Direct catalysis of lysine 48-linked polyubiquitin chains by the ubiquitin-activating enzyme.
Expression, purification and characterization of human ubiquitin-activating enzyme, UBE1.
High-yield expression in Escherichia coli and purification of mouse ubiquitin-activating enzyme E1.
